decks.notes: This deck focuses on building a strong board presence with creatures that benefit from +1/+1 counters, using Hardened Scales to increase the effectiveness of those counters. The deck includes cards like Steel Overseer and Hangarback Walker to distribute counters and generate tokens, while also utilizing Arcbound Ravager to move counters around and potentially sacrifice creatures for a stronger board presence. The deck has a strong synergy between its creatures and artifacts, allowing for explosive turns and aggressive plays to overwhelm the opponent quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost and efficient Human creature cards to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage. The synergy between cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Noble Hierarch helps to rapidly grow the size of the creatures on the battlefield. Reflector Mage and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed. The deck aims to establish board presence early on and maintain pressure throughout the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive spirits to overwhelm opponents quickly. By playing creatures with powerful abilities like flying and hexproof, combined with support cards like Aether Vial and Collected Company, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. With a mix of disruptive and evasive creatures, the deck can disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing consistent damage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also providing access to important lands like Moorland Haunt and Horizon Canopy.

The main concept of this deck is to create a powerful combo using the Krark-Clan Ironworks artifact and its supporting cards. The deck focuses on generating mana and card draw through cards like Chromatic Star, Chromatic Sphere, Ichor Wellspring, and Scrap Trawler. It also includes cards like Mox Opal and Mind Stone for additional resources. The deck utilizes Buried Ruin and Inventors' Fair to retrieve key artifacts from the graveyard. The combo is then executed by sacrificing artifacts with the Krark-Clan Ironworks to generate a large amount of mana and win the game.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures quickly and efficiently, utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up the team. By utilizing Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat, the deck can quickly put out threats and disrupt the opponent with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter. With a mix of disruptive and evasive creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and close out the game quickly before they can stabilize. The mana base is optimized to support the Human tribal theme and ensure consistent casting of creatures.

The main idea of this Jeskai Control deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage provided by cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while developing its own mana base and drawing cards efficiently. With access to a variety of removal spells like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict, along with versatile counterspells such as Cryptic Command and Logic Knot, the deck can handle a wide range of threats and maintain control of the game until it can win with a threat like Celestial Colonnade or Secure the Wastes.

This Spirit Aggro deck focuses on building a board presence quickly with lower-cost spirits like Mausoleum Wanderer and Supreme Phantom, while utilizing cards like Collected Company to search for additional threats. The deck includes disruption with Spell Queller and Path to Exile, along with protection from board wipes with Selfless Spirit. The synergy between creatures like Drogskol Captain and Geist of Saint Traft, along with the ability to generate value from entering-the-battlefield effects, allows the deck to apply consistent pressure and close out games efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing lethal poison damage to the opponent by using evasive creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf along with pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa. Protection spells like Blossoming Defense and Vines of Vastwood help keep the creatures alive while also serving as combat tricks. The goal is to quickly assemble a lethal attack and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or remove the infect creatures. The deck aims to win the game in just a few turns through a powerful combination of creatures and spells.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively swarm the battlefield with creatures and use cards like Chord of Calling and Collected Company to quickly find additional creatures. The deck focuses on the Selesnya (Green/White) color combination and utilizes cards like Birds of Paradise, Knight of the Reliquary, and Noble Hierarch to ramp up mana and accelerate its strategy. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Fairgrounds Warden and Scavenging Ooze to control the opponent's board presence. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent through aggressive creature plays while maintaining a versatile and adaptable gameplay.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It utilizes cards like Path to Exile, Cryptic Command, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent. The deck also runs a small number of win conditions, such as Celestial Colonnade, to close out the game once control has been established. Overall, the key idea is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while assembling a winning position through card advantage and powerful planeswalkers.

This Mardu Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost removal and disruption spells to control the board while generating value from creatures like Bedlam Reveler and Young Pyromancer. Faithless Looting and Manamorphose help filter through the deck, while Lingering Souls provides a constant stream of flying threats. With the ability to quickly empty the opponent's hand and apply pressure with a wide range of threats, this deck aims to win the game through a combination of aggression and disruption, making it a powerful contender in the Modern format.

The focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan. It aims to do this by utilizing a variety of counterspells such as Negate, Logic Knot, and Cryptic Command to counter the opponent's key threats and spells. The deck also includes removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus to get rid of opposing creatures. It has card advantage through draw spells like Serum Visions, Ancestral Vision, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The win condition is typically through slow, incremental damage using Celestial Colonnade and planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to efficiently control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan by using a combination of counter spells, removal, and card advantage. With cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor providing powerful card advantage and control options, backed up by efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition. The deck also includes a mix of versatile threats like Vendilion Clique and Celestial Colonnade to close out games efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly dumping cards into the graveyard to enable powerful graveyard synergies, such as casting Hollow One for free and bringing back Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix. The deck utilizes cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry to fuel the graveyard while also maintaining pressure with aggressive creatures like Flameblade Adept and Gurmag Angler. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence while leveraging the graveyard as a resource.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard using cards like Grisly Salvage, Faithless Looting, and Stitcher's Supplier. This allows the player to generate value from Bridge from Below by sacrificing creatures like Insolent Neonate and Viscera Seer. The deck also utilizes the synergy between Vengevine and Gravecrawler to repeatedly bring back creatures from the graveyard. Walking Ballista serves as a backup win condition, while cards like Hangarback Walker and Goblin Bushwhacker provide additional utility and pressure. The land base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the deck's spells.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage in order to outlast and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Path to Exile, Detention Sphere, and Terminus. It also focuses on card draw and selection with cards like Opt, Serum Visions, and Search for Azcanta. The win conditions in the deck include Celestial Colonnade and planeswalkers such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.
